name: European Committee for Electrotechnical Standardization
goal: Is responsible for standardization in the electrotechnical engineering. It is the recognized European organisation according to Regulation 1025/2012 for the planning, drafting and adoption of European standards in the electrotechnical engineering field
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Development, Education, Energy, Enlargement, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Information Society, Internal Market, Research and Technology, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: EU policy on European standardization as defined in EU Regulation 1025/2012 and other EU policies/legislative initiatives involving European standardization
